intro: Dampiera roycei, commonly known as the slender damper, is a flowering plant native to south-western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Dampiera roycei is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
